tags.description: Cobble beach with some boulders. S aspect. Reef gives some protection from NW. A few upland forest sites with potential for many more. Water at small creek.
tags.name: Simson Reef (BCMT)

tags.description: Informal site secondary. Exposed to NW. Upland forest site 50 m S of creek in front of small cliff had rockfall 2021 At Neaps potential beach camp next to drift logs. View. Water at falls, likely year round.
tags.name: Waterfall Beach (BCMT)

tags.description: Cobble beach with some boulders, tricky at high tide. Some protection from NW. Forest very dense behind beach but up rocks on E side is small level point with room for 3 or more tents in upland forest. Some brushing needed. Water at small creek. View.
tags.name: Nelson Beach West (BCMT)

tags.description: Informal site primary. White, shallow sand beach. Camp on beach or in forest clearings. JK guide has camp at 50 28.95N 126 01.64W. Some sites are adjacent to logged area further from creek. Water at creek. Aka West Blenkinsop Cove on Cruising Planner map.
tags.name: Little Blenkinsop Bay (BCMT)

tags.description: Dispersed site primary. Several unofficial sites on grass by shore or on trails further N. Loses sun early. Preferred camp location not yet established but likely near Courtenay Bay landing, possibly in 2019.
tags.description:comments: Composting (mouldering) toilet at fort site. No camping near fort. Historic WW2 defensive gun position. Hiking trails. Maintained by Sayward Futures Society. Hazards include overgrown bunkers, wire, decaying buildings. Conservation work proceeding.
tags.description:landing: Easy on protected pebble beach among boulders in cove behind islets on S side of island. Beach at Courtenay Bay on E side of island may be preferred access, camp location but is hazardous because of barbed wire defences in undergrowth.
tags.description:landing_2: Very rough, hazardous water conditions may occur near S and W shores of in strong wind, ebb tides.
tags.name: Yorke Island (BCMT)

tags.description: Undeveloped. Steep narrow beach with logs make landing tricky at higher tides. Usable for NW winds. Small cleared upland forest site on NE of bay, clearcut behind. Brushing might be required.
tags.name: Nichols Bay (BCMT)
